c74object.name: bach.join
c74object.description: Joins lllls together, according to the positions of the inlets by which they are received.

inlet.digest: llll to be joined to the ones in the other inlets

outlet.digest: All the incoming lllls joined together

method.name: bang
method.description: A bang in any inlet, hot or cold, will cause all the lllls received in the inlets to be chained together and output.

method.name: llll
method.digest: Join the llll to the others
method.description: The llll will be joined to all the other lllls received in the other inlets, in the order given by each inlet's position. A null llll is ignored. If the inlet is marked as "hot" by the triggers attribute, the resulting llll is output.

attribute.name: inwrap
attribute.description: Wrap every incoming llll in the corresponding number of parentheses. This is equivalent to connecting a bach.wrap object to every llll inlet.

attribute.name: out
attribute.description:
The out attribute is a sequence of characters identifying the outlet types (one character for each llll outlet). Characters can be one of the following:
n (default): 'native' output: faster and more precise between bach objects, but unreadable by standard Max objects (an "bach.llll" message appears instead).
t: 'text' output: slower and limited in size, but readable by standard Max objects. A plain llll in text format is a generic Max message. To keep the representation invertible (i.e., to allow a bach object receiving a text-format llll to interpret it exactly as if it was native format, except for the size limitation), some specific kinds of symbols are preceded by a backtick: namely, symbols containing parens, or containing textual representations of numbers or pitches, or beginning with a backtick, plus the symbols "null" and "nil" (distinct from the reserved words "null" and "nil" representing the empty list and the empty sublist) are preceded by a backtick. Moreover, the symbols "int", "float" or "list" are preceded by a backtick only if they are the first element of an llll, to distinguish them from the corresponding reserved messages of Max.
m: 'max' output: mostly equivalent to the specifier, but no symbol is backticket except "int", "float" and "list" at the beginning of an llll. It is important to notice that, differently from text-format lllls proper, Max-format lllls might not be invertible even if they do not reach the size limit for Max message. This means that a bach object receiving a Max-format llll output from another bach object might interpret it differently from the original, or in some cases might even reject it.
x: disabled output (nothing is output)
p: 'portal' output: only used by bach.portal to intercept the @out attribute specified while creating the abstraction (see bach.portal).
The native output is recommended, unless communication with standard Max messages is needed. Disabling unused outputs can be useful if extreme optimization of the patch is needed.

attribute.name: outwrap
attribute.description: Wrap every output llll in the correspongind number of parentheses. This is equivalent to connecting a bach.wrap object to every llll outlet.

attribute.name: set
attribute.description:
The set attribute allows providing the inlets of bach.join with default lllls. The contents of each sublist of the set attribute is assigned to one inlet. So set (a b) (c d) ((e f)) will assign a b to the first inlet, c d to the second, (e f) to the third. If bach.join has less inlets than the size of the set llll, the elements in excess are ignored. If it has more inlets, the inlets in excess are cleared. set null clears all the inlets.
Elements without parentheses are assigned to distinct inlets, as if each had a couple of parentheses around it. So set a b c will assign a to the first inlet, b to the second, c to the third.
The set attribute can't be set through the object inspector.

attribute.name: triggers
attribute.description: A list setting which inlets are "hot" (i.e., which will will trigger the result). Inlets are counted from 1. 0 means that all inlets are hot. Negative indices are counted from the right (e.g., -1 means the rightmost inlet). null means that all inlets are cold, but a bang in any inlet will still cause the llll to be output. The default is 1.

entry.name: Inlets 1, 2, 3... (llll)
entry.description: llll to be joined to the ones in the other inlets.

entry.name: Outlet 1 (llll)
entry.description: All the incoming lllls joined together.
